Reviews.Title: Blackberry 8700 unlocked
Reviews.Author: J Money
Reviews.Content: So I broke my smartphone a while back. Well since my contract is over in October, I figured I would buy a cheap replacement phone just to last me until I can sign a new contract. BE WARNED! There are a few different reasons why this phone is so cheap. First of all, its a total brick. Weighs a ton, and is just about 3/4 of an inch thick. The buttons feel very cheap and overall it is just a truly ugly design. It has the side scrolling wheel, which is a nightmare in itself and can be difficult to use. Design and ease of use are definitely the 2 biggest flaws with this phone. But as far as functionality is concerned, this thing runs like a champ. For the 3 months that I have had this phone, it has NEVER dropped a single call and has never had any trouble sending/receiving text messages. The call clarity is very impressive and the speaker phone works wonderfully well.In conclusion, even though it is uglier that sin and feels like you have a fistful of rocks in your pocket, it does work very well. It has no fancy bells or whistles but it will do a damn fine job just making and receiving calls and texts.

Reviews.Title: BIG DISAPOINTMENT
Reviews.Author: L. A. Cook "SUMMERBUDDY45"
Reviews.Content: This item was listed as  a BLACKBERRY 8700C.It was not it turned out to be a 8700,which was useless for my needs.I bought this because it was listed as a 8700c and I would be able to download apps through the website,Blackberry Apps.Because the seller did not list the correct model,I received a Blackberry that could not download apps,as simple a Facebook and Twitter.I also had a problem with an error message that kept coming up.Although I reset the device,the error message returned time and time again.I would not reccomend this seller do to his incorrect listing of the model of Blackberry he was selling.I feel that I was lied to as well as duped.
